desc: Exchanges a temporary OAuth verifier code for an access token.

client_id.desc: Issued when you created your application. If possible, avoid sending `client_id` and `client_secret` as parameters in your request and instead supply the Client ID and Client Secret using the HTTP Basic authentication scheme.

client_secret.desc: Issued when you created your application. If possible, avoid sending `client_id` and `client_secret` as parameters in your request and instead supply the Client ID and Client Secret using the HTTP Basic authentication scheme.

code.desc: The `code` param returned via the OAuth callback.

redirect_uri.desc: This must match the originally submitted URI (if one was sent).

grant_type.desc: The `grant_type` param as described in the OAuth spec.

refresh_token.desc: The `refresh_token` param as described in the OAuth spec.

output.desc: Credentials and other app installation information

access_token.desc: A bot access token. Only present if requested at the start of the auth flow.

token_type.desc: The type of access token. Only present if a bot token was requested at the start of the auth flow.

scope.desc: Comma-separated list of scopes granted to the token. Only present if a bot token was requested at the start of the auth flow.

bot_user_id.desc: The user ID of the bot user corresponding to the token. Only present if a bot token was requested at the start of the auth flow.

user_id.desc: The user ID of the bot user corresponding to the token. Only present during a refresh_token grant_type for a user access token.

app_id.desc: ID of the app being installed or re-installed.

is_enterprise_install.desc: Boolean flag indicating whether the generated token is enterprise level token or not

expires_in.desc: Time until this credential expires, if it expires at all

anyOf.desc: Details about the installing user, and the user token if one was requested at the start of the auth flow.

id.desc: ID of the team into which the app is being installed or re-installed.

name.desc: Name of the team into which the app is being installed or re-installed.

anyOf.desc: Details about the installing team, and the user token if one was requested at the start of the auth flow.

id.desc: ID of the enterprise into which the app is being installed or re-installed.

name.desc: Name of the enterprise into which the app is being installed or re-installed.

authed_user.desc: Details about the installing user, and the user token if one was requested at the start of the auth flow.

id.desc: ID of the installing user. If a user token was requested, this is also the ID of the user to which the user token authenticates.

access_token.desc: A user token. Only presented if requested at the start of the auth flow.

token_type.desc: The type of the access token. Only present if a user token was requested at the start of the auth flow.

scope.desc: Comma-separated list of scopes granted to the user token. Only present if a user token was requested at the start of the auth flow.

expires_in.desc: Time until this credential expires, if it expires at all

incoming_webhook.desc: Details about a newly-created incoming webhook. Only present if an incoming webhook was requested at the start of the auth flow.

bad_redirect_uri.desc: Value passed for `redirect_uri` did not match the `redirect_uri` in the original request.

cannot_install_an_org_installed_app.desc: Returned when the the org-installed app cannot be installed on a workspace.

invalid_refresh_token.desc: The given refresh token is invalid.

oauth_authorization_url_mismatch.desc: The OAuth flow was initiated on an incorrect version of the authorization url. The flow must be initiated via /oauth/v2/authorize .

preview_feature_not_available.desc: Returned when the API method is not yet available on the team in context.

success.description: Successful token request with scopes for both a bot user and a user token

success_with_token_rotation.description: Successful token request with scopes for both a bot user and a user token, and token rotation enabled

success_with_sign_in_with_slack.description: Successful Sign in with Slack response
